coded_texts: access to areas: Access to areas difficult or only reachable through considerable dangers for people
are mentally superior: No trauma for rescuers

**remote control: Can be operated by experts via remote control**<sup>safety; remote operation</sup> **or autonomous systems to perform operations from a safe distance.**<sup>safety; remote operation</sup>

**More flexible than human: People cannot access some areas or cannot see whether people are still alive.**<sup>accessibility; assessment</sup> **For example, in an earthquake incident under the rubble.**<sup>accessibility; assessment</sup>
**area of application: Can be used in areas that are too dangerous for humans.**<sup>accessibility; safety</sup>
**Range: Robots, again just the drone can rescue victims faster in difficult terrain or bring help, e.g. medicine, food**<sup>accessibility; safety</sup>
toxic places: Places where people can only breathe with special equipment (gas mask)
**protection of rescue forces: Reduced deployment of human rescue forces in dangerous situations**<sup>safety</sup>
faster access: easier access to dangerous place

code_descriptions.safety: Captures discussions where participants highlight the perceived safety benefits of the search and rescue robot being remotely controlled by experts, thereby minimizing human risk in hazardous environments.
code_descriptions.remote operation: Captures instances where participants highlight the ability of search and rescue robots to be operated from a distance by skilled professionals, emphasizing the safety benefits of minimizing human exposure to hazardous environments.
code_descriptions.accessibility: Captures instances where participants highlight the ability of search and rescue robots to access hazardous or confined spaces that are challenging or impossible for humans to reach, thereby enhancing the effectiveness and safety of rescue operations.
code_descriptions.assessment: Captures instances where participants evaluate the capabilities of search and rescue robots, particularly highlighting their ability to access areas and assess situations that may be challenging or impossible for humans.
